title: Elderly passenger dies after being left on island | 7NEWS
description: An 80-year-old Australian woman died after being left behind during a day excursion on Lizard Island in North Queensland while travelling on the Coral Adventurer cruise ship. Maritime safety officers are preparing to board the vessel when it docks in Darwin to investigate the incident. The cruise ship company is cooperating with authorities and a coroner's report will be prepared. title: Israel strikes Gaza over hostage remains breach | 7NEWS
description: Israeli Prime Minister orders immediate powerful strikes in Gaza, accusing Hamas of violating the ceasefire agreement by failing to properly return hostage remains. The breach involves Hamas returning the body of Ofer Tsarfati, whose remains were already recovered by Israeli forces in 2023, rather than one of the 13 remaining deceased hostages still held in Gaza. This marks the second time Israeli military has conducted airstrikes after alleging Hamas ceasefire violations. title: Major police sting nets 30 arrests across SA | 7NEWS
description: More than 30 people have been arrested in a statewide police sting across South Australia, believed to be linked to the encrypted messaging app Anom. Two courtrooms have been set aside at the Adelaide Magistrates Court to hear all the cases. Police are expected to release more details later this afternoon. title: Woman charged over hospital sabotage linked to patient death | 7NEWS
description: A 42-year-old woman, Vanessa Moulton, has been charged with sabotage after allegedly cutting gas and water supply lines to two hospitals in Caringbah, Sydney. Police are investigating whether her actions caused the death of a 72-year-old patient at Sutherland Hospital, which occurred in the hours following the alleged sabotage. Moulton appeared at Sutherland Local Court, pleaded not guilty to charges including public nuisance, trespass, sabotage and property damage, and was refused bail. title: Inflation spike kills Melbourne Cup rate cut hopes | 7NEWS
description: Australia's inflation rate has risen to 3.2% headline and 3% underlying, marking the first increase in underlying inflation since 2022. Electricity prices have surged 23% over the past 12 months, driving the inflation spike and pushing the underlying rate to the top of the Reserve Bank's 2-3% target band. The Reserve Bank Board is now extremely unlikely to cut the cash rate from its current 3.6% when it meets on Melbourne Cup Day. title: Oasis arrives in Australia for reunion tour | 7NEWS
description: British rock band Oasis has arrived in Australia for their highly anticipated reunion tour. Frontman Liam Gallagher was spotted making a low-key arrival in Melbourne wearing a bucket hat and sunglasses. The band will perform three shows starting Friday in Melbourne before moving to Sydney. title: Armed gang threatens Melbourne family in home invasion | 7NEWS
description: Three armed men broke into a family home in Melbourne's inner east at 3am, threatening a 46-year-old father with hammers and bats while demanding car keys. The intruders fled in the family's white Jeep Cherokee after the father's three-and-a-half-year-old daughter briefly appeared during the confrontation. No one was injured in the incident, which adds to Melbourne's escalating run of home invasions. title: Two miners killed in Cobar mine explosion | 7NEWS
description: Two miners were killed in an underground explosion at the Polymetals Silver and Zinc Mine in Cobar, New South Wales, just before 4am yesterday morning. The victims were 66-year-old Ambrose McMullen and 24-year-old Holly Clarke, while sole survivor 24-year-old Mackenzie Stirling was airlifted to Orange Hospital with hearing damage and shock. An investigation including a full audit of safety processes is underway, with the mine remaining closed and Polymetals in a trading halt. title: Queensland reinstates puberty blocker ban hours after court ruling | 7NEWS
description: Queensland's Health Minister Tim Nicholls has reinstated a ban on doctors prescribing puberty blockers for gender dysphoric adolescents, just six hours after the Supreme Court ruled the original ban unlawful. The judge clarified his decision was based on legal requirements rather than health advice, allowing the Minister to implement his own pause on these healthcare services. title: Critical shortage of O-negative blood in Australia | 7NEWS
description: Australia's blood supply is experiencing a critical shortage of O-negative blood, the universal blood type that can be given to any patient during emergencies. Lifeblood requires a blood donation every 18 seconds to meet patient demand and is urgently seeking more donors this week. title: Queensland students taught wrong history topic for exams | 7NEWS
description: An investigation has been ordered into a major education blunder in Queensland where students from up to nine schools were taught the wrong topic for their Year 12 ancient history exams. The 140 affected students learnt about Augustus instead of Julius Caesar, but the state's education minister says they will be scored using their completed assessments and will not be disadvantaged. School leavers are sitting their final exams today. title: Billions in super sitting unclaimed | 7NEWS
description: The federal government has revealed $19 billion in superannuation is currently sitting lost or unclaimed across Australia. This can occur when people change their name, change jobs, or work overseas, potentially resulting in multiple fees being charged. Australians can check if they're owed money through their super fund directly or via the Super Health Check portal on their ATO-linked myGov account. title: Patients dies at Sutherland Hospital after critical services allegedly cut off
description: A patient has died after the gas supply was allegedly switched off at Sutherland Hospital in Sydney's south. #hospital #gas #oxygen #sutherland #sydney

title: Building resilience in struggling young minds | 7NEWS
description: Scott Watters, founder of Life Changer, discusses the mental health crisis affecting young people globally, with 80% suffering mental health issues in the past two years. His program worked with 141,000 young people last year, focusing on building resilience skills and social connections before problems develop. Watters emphasises the importance of meaningful presence and conversation, noting that adults spend only 18 seconds daily in meaningful conversation with young people in their lives. title: Exclusive chat with rock icon Jimmy Barnes on health recovery
